page.title: 19Living in the Thorney Fens
page.content: At one time almost one-third of the children in the village school travelled in from the surrounding fens but nowadays less than one-sixth arrive every morning by bus.The {mechanisation of farms}means{less {agricultural workers}are needed and many of the small communities are no longer there.What do the remaining few children think about their life on the fens? We asked ten of them, aged between 9 and 11, to tell us a little about the advantages and disadvantages {One of the main problems}is the{lack {of friends to play with,}and half the children would rather live in the village because of this. The others felt that the countryside offered so much variety and interest that they could manage to put up with the occassional bout of loneliness. {*CONTINUED*
